statistics.name: freeThrows

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Gonzaga 87, Portland 67
article.story: SPOKANE, Wash. (AP) -- Senior Derek Raivio, playing his last home game for Gonzaga, led the Bulldogs with 20 points Monday night as they defeated Portland 87-67. Matt Bouldin scored 18 points for Gonzaga (19-10, 9-3 West Coast Conference) while reserves Micah Downs and David Pendergraft added career highs of 19 and 15 points, respectively. Freshman Parker Emerson led Portland (8-20, 4-8) with a season-high 23 points. Taishi Ito had 15 points for the Pilots, who have lost eight in a row to Gonzaga and 22 of the teams' last 23 meetings. Gonzaga led 47-21 at the half. The Bulldogs, trying to win their seventh consecutive WCC regular-season title, shot 52 percent from the field and 41 percent on 3-pointers. Portland shot 38 percent from the field and 36 percent on 3-pointers. Before Monday night's game, Gonzaga had lost two in a row in Spokane for the first time since January 1995. Santa Clara snapped Gonzaga's 50-game home winning streak -- the longest active home winning streak in NCAA Division I -- last Monday. No. 8 Memphis beat Gonzaga at the Spokane Arena on Saturday.
